definition: feeling or desire to do sth/interest in sth/excitement
to rise/to flourish/to become popular/to start/to encourage/to get up/(often used in the negative) to permit or allow (dialect)/maybe (dialect)

sentences.english: I didn't know who Henry Kissinger was, and I might have asked.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道基辛格是何許人，興許隨口問了。

sentences.english: The film was not, as you might imagine, a piece of government-produced propaganda.
sentences.chinese: 你興許以爲該影片乃政府製作的紅色宣傳片。

sentences.english: What you said has some effect.
She'll probably want to send us a housewarming gift.
sentences.chinese: 她興許想送我們一件喬遷禮物呢。

sentences.english: I saw ten thousand people, nike basketball shoes, maybe more.
sentences.chinese: 我望睹敗千下萬的人們，興許更多。

sentences.english: However, I want to comment points where he is probably right.
sentences.chinese: 但是我想談談他興許正確的幾點看法。

sentences.english: Hey who knows, maybe by the year 2311 they may put a man on the moon.
sentences.chinese: 不過誰知道呢，興許2311年他們能把人送上月球。

sentences.english: Perspective-taking once, paul smith eyewear, maybe they wouldn't do acute action.
sentences.chinese: 換位思考一下，興許就不會做出劇烈的行動來了。

sentences.english: You see the world all wrong, may be you stand slanting.
sentences.chinese: 締你看全世界都不對時，興許是你自己站歪了。

sentences.english: Maybe you will even make your hobby into the business!
sentences.chinese: 興許你還能依靠你的愛好賺錢呢。

sentences.english: Perhaps the Snail Girl was just a tale, but the young man Huangbaishan was a real person.
sentences.chinese: 田螺姑娘興許是傳說，但黃百三郎可是確有其人。

sentences.english: Maybe it was just my imagination, but people began to stare.
sentences.chinese: 興許，這純屬我的想象，但人們開始注視我。

sentences.english: Perspective-taking once, maybe they wouldn't do acute action.
sentences.chinese: 換位思考一下，興許就不會做出劇烈的行動來了。

sentences.english: Yet things may get worse before they get better.
sentences.chinese: 然而，勢態好轉前，興許會惡化。

sentences.english: Eveline:I don't have an aspirin. Perhaps you should go to a doctor.
sentences.chinese: 我沒有，興許你得去看看醫生了。
